text:
<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1 cup boiling water
- 2 cups sweet milk
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 1 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Bring water to a boil and add cornmeal, stirring rapidly until well mixed.
Add sweet milk, butter, baking powder, beaten eggs, and salt.
Mix thoroughly and pour into a baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for about 40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup sweet milk
- 3.5 cups flour
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 6 egg whites
- 2 cups sugar, for filling
- Milk of 1 cocoanut
- 1 tsp cream of tartar
- 3 egg whites, for filling
- Grated meat of 1 cocoanut
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, gradually add flour sifted with baking powder, and sweet milk.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into layer pans and bake in a moderate oven.
For filling, cook sugar and cocoanut milk until it ropes.
Add cream of tartar, pour over stiffly beaten egg whites, and beat.
Add grated cocoanut and ice the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- Juice of 1 lemon
- ¾ cup sugar
- Pinch of salt
- 2 packages gelatin
- 1 cup water
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- 1 cup cream, whipped
- Lettuce and mayonnaise for serving
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, lemon juice, sugar, and salt; bring to a boil.
Soak gelatin in water, then add to the hot pineapple mixture; beat vigorously and cool, stirring occasionally.
When the mixture begins to set, add grated cheese and whipped cream.
Pour into individual molds, an 8 x 12-inch pan, or a large ring mold; let congeal overnight.
Serve on lettuce, topped with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can pink salmon
- 1 large onion
- 3 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 apple
- Pepper and salt to taste
- 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Chop salmon, onion, eggs, and apple together.
Add mayonnaise, pepper, and salt, mix well.
Serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLASSES PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. molasses
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup. butter, melted
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix molasses, sugar, eggs, and butter, stir in pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 50-55 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP STUFFED EGGPLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stalk celery, diced
- 1 quart soft bread crumbs
- 1 large eggplant
- 3 tablespoons butter or olive oil
- 11/2 pounds shrimp, fresh or frozen
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/3 cup water
- ¾ teaspoon oregano
- 1/2 cup fine dried bread crumbs
- 1 tablespoon melted butter
- Parsley, for garnish
<|steps|>
Shell and devein shrimp.
Cut eggplant lengthwise into halves, scrape out pulp leaving ½-inch thick shells, and cook pulp in water just to cover until tender (about 15 minutes); drain well.
Cook shrimp in boiling salted water for 3 minutes, drain, soak in cold water, and dice, reserving a few whole shrimp for garnish.
Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a skillet, add onion and celery, and cook until tender but not browned.
Add soft bread crumbs, water, salt, oregano, cooked eggplant, and diced shrimp to skillet; toss gently until well mixed.
Fill eggplant shells with mixture.
Combine dried bread crumbs with 1 tablespoon melted butter and sprinkle over shrimp mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until crumbs are browned.
Garnish with whole shrimp and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRACKLIN GOOD CORNBREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. cracklings
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, add cracklings.
Combine milk and egg, add to dry ingredients.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWISS STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. round steak
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Pound flour, salt, and pepper into steak.
Brown steak in fat, add onion, tomatoes, and water.
Cover, simmer 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED OYSTERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 bunches green onions, including tops, chopped
- 6 stalks celery, finely chopped
- 1 large bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp parsley, chopped
- 3 tbsp flour
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 pint oysters, chopped, with liquid
- 0.5 stick margarine
- 0.125 tsp black pepper
- 0.5 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Sauté green onions, celery, bell pepper, and parsley in margarine.
Add flour, oysters, oyster liquid, Worcestershire sauce, black pepper, and salt.
Cook until thickened.
Serve in small bite-size patty shells, piping hot, for about 20 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOMEMADE CHILI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 can tomato paste
- 1 can red beans
<|steps|>
Season meat and brown in Wesson oil.
Put in tomato paste and red beans and add about 3 cans of water.
Put in a little sugar to keep tomato from tasting flat and chili powder to taste.
Makes from 4 to 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN BEAN BAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can chedder cheese soup
- ⅓ cup milk
- 3 cups cooked and drained French Style green beans
- 1 can (31/2 oz.) French Fried onions
<|steps|>
In 1½ quart casserole, stir chedder cheese soup until smooth.
Gradually add milk.
Mix cooked beans and 1 can onions into soup mixture.
Bake 350°F for 20 minutes or until bubbling.
Sprinkle remaining onions on top of casserole.
Bake 5 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart sweet milk
- 1 cup shortening
- 1 scant cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 2 yeast cakes
- 1 quart flour (plus additional to make stiff dough)
- 1 teaspoon sugar (for yeast)
<|steps|>
Scald milk, then add melted shortening and sugar. Cool to lukewarm.
Dissolve yeast cakes in warm water with 1 teaspoon sugar, then add to the cooled milk mixture.
Let the mixture stand for 2 hours until doubled in size (use a large pan).
Sift flour with salt, baking soda, and baking powder.
Add the flour mixture to the yeast mixture and beat with an electric beater until a light batter forms.
Add enough additional flour to make a stiff dough.
Store in the refrigerator and use as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARSHMALLOW CREAM FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. sugar
- 1 (13 oz.) can Pet milk
- 2 sticks oleo
- 1 jar marshmallow cream
- 3 (6 oz.) pkgs. chocolate chips
- 3 cup. chopped pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 lb. butter
- 1 lb. light brown sugar
- 1 cup. white Karo
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- Nuts (optional)
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. soda
- 1 cup. evaporated milk
- 2 cup. pecans
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, milk, and oleo; cook until it forms a soft ball in ice water, about 20 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add marshmallow cream, chocolate chips, pecans, and vanilla; blend well.
Pour into a greased pan and chill until firm.
**CARAMELS**
Melt butter, add Karo, brown sugar, and milk; cook until it forms a soft, firm ball, stirring constantly.
Pour into a slightly buttered pan.
Add nuts if desired.
When cold, cut and wrap individually.
**PRALINES**
Mix sugar and soda well, add milk, and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until it forms a soft ball.
Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, and pecans.
Stir until thick and creamy enough to drop by spoon onto greased foil.
Add a spoon of water if needed to maintain dropping consistency.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEEP DISH APPLE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cup. sliced apples
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Place in deep baking dish, dot with butter.
Cover with pie crust, slit top.
Bake at 375°F for 45-50 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WALDORF ASTORIA RED CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 1.25 cups white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 2 oz red food coloring
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2.5 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp vinegar
- 2 tsp cocoa
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup butter
- 3 tbsp flour
<|steps|>
Mix vinegar and baking soda in a small cup and let stand.
Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Make a paste of cocoa and some red food coloring; add to creamed mixture.
Add remaining coloring, then alternate buttermilk, salt, and flour.
Add vanilla, then soda and vinegar mixture; stir well.
Pour into two 8-inch pans and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Cool and split layers in half lengthwise.
For frosting, cook 3 tbsp flour and milk until thick, then cool.
Cream 1 cup sugar and butter until fluffy, gradually add flour-milk mixture, beating constantly.
Spread frosting between layers and on top, for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG-PLANT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large eggplant
- 3 Tbsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 cup. sweet milk
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. celery salt
- 1/4 tsp. onion salt
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Pare and slice eggplant, sprinkle salt over slices, let stand 1 hour.
Drain, rinse, dice, cook until tender, drain, mash.
Make sauce of flour, milk, and margarine, cook until thick, add paprika, celery salt, onion salt, and cheese.
Pour into baking dish, sprinkle with crumbs, bake at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MUSHROOM RICE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup rice
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 can creamed mushroom soup
- 1 small can mushroom stems and pieces
- Broken pecans or almonds
- 1/2 cup butter
- 12 oranges
- 1 can pineapple chunks
- 1 fresh coconut, grated
- 1 fresh grapefruit
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Sugar, to taste
- Red cherries or strawberries, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil rice, rinse, and season with nutmeg.
In a well-greased casserole, layer rice, mushroom soup, broken nuts, and mushrooms.
Repeat layers, ending with nuts on top.
Melt butter and pour over the casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until heated through.
Optionally, prepare the day before and add melted butter just before baking.
**AMBROSIA**
Peel and cut oranges into chunks.
Add pineapple chunks (with juice), grapefruit segments, lemon juice, and grated coconut.
Sweeten to taste.
Refrigerate overnight to season thoroughly.
Garnish with red cherries or strawberries before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ONION SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 cups thinly sliced onions
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 6 cups soup stock or canned bouillon
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Toast with grated Parmesan or other cheese
<|steps|>
Sauté onions in butter until light brown.
Stir in flour, soup stock, and Worcestershire sauce.
Simmer covered for one hour or longer.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with cheese-sprinkled toast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DILL GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans (1 pound) whole green beans
- 11/4 teaspoons dill seeds
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 6 tablespoons flour
- 6 tablespoons oleo
- 3 teaspoons grated onion
- 21/2 teaspoons Accent
- Dash of Tabasco
- 1 cup bean juice
- 11/2 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook green beans with dill seeds and bacon drippings for 45 minutes, reserving 1 cup of bean juice; let cool.
For the white sauce, melt oleo, then stir in flour, grated onion, Accent, Tabasco, pepper, and salt; cook until thick.
Add bean juice and milk to the sauce, stirring until thickened.
Place green beans in a greased 2-quart casserole, pour white sauce over, and bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until piping hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINT TEA PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 cup. brisk tea
- 1 cup. frozen lemonade
- 3/4 cup. mint syrup
- **Mint Syrup:**
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. water
- 30 mint leaves
<|steps|>
For the mint syrup, bruise mint leaves in sugar.
Add water and stir over heat until sugar dissolves.
Simmer 3 to 5 minutes. Strain out leaves, store in refrigerator.
Combine tea, lemonade, and mint syrup.
Serve chilled.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN BANANA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup lemon juice
- 4 bananas, mashed
- 1 pint heavy cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Mix pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice in a saucepan and cook until sugar dissolves.
Cool slightly, then stir in mashed bananas.
Fold in whipped cream and chopped nuts.
Pour into a mold or ice tray and freeze until firm.
Unmold onto lettuce leaves to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD DE LUXE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large ears of corn, cut from cob and scraped, or 1 can (No. 2) cream-style corn
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1/4 pound longhorn cheese, diced
- 1 small can chili, cut fine
- 1 cup yellow corn meal
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup shortening, oil, oleo, or butter
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a well-greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan or 8-inch iron skillet.
Bake at 375°F until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROILED GRAPEFRUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 grapefruit
- Butter, as needed
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- Maraschino cherry, for garnish
- 2 cups flour
- 3 eggs
- 4 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 1/2 cup Wesson oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Cut grapefruit crosswise, remove seeds, snip out centers, and loosen each section.
Spread each grapefruit half with 1 tablespoon brown sugar and dot with butter.
Heat in a 325°F oven for about 15 minutes.
Place under a broiler to brown slightly.
Garnish with a Maraschino cherry before serving.
**WAFFLES**
Beat eggs with a rotary beater until very light and fluffy.
Thoroughly beat in Wesson oil, then add milk and beat well.
Sift salt and baking powder with flour.
Add dry ingredients to the liquid mixture, beating until thoroughly mixed.
Bake on a hot waffle iron.
Optionally, prepare the batter the night before and store in the refrigerator for breakfast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cooked, mashed carrots
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix carrots, milk, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes, then 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For icing, melt brown sugar, butter, and milk, boil 2 minutes, cool, add powdered sugar, beat until smooth, spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCA-COLA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. raspberry gelatine
- 1 pkg. cherry gelatine
- 1 can seedless white cherries
- 1 cup pecans
- 1 - 8 oz. pkg. cream cheese (frozen)
- 2 Coca-Colas (partially frozen)
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatine in heated cherry and pineapple juices.
Add Coca-Colas, cherries, pineapple, and nuts.
Grate frozen cream cheese over molds.
Refrigerate to congeal. Serves 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, simmer 15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti, drain.
Mix spaghetti with meat sauce, place in casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUR CREAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cup. sugar
- 2 sticks soft butter
- 6 eggs, beat in 1 at a time
- 2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 3 cup. flour with 1/4 tsp. soda sifted in it
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, then flour a little at a time with cream.
Bake 1 1/2 hours in a big tube pan at 325 degrees or until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUNGRY BOY CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Casserole:**
- 1 pound ground meat
- 1 cup diced celery
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup green peppers
- 1 clove minced garlic
- 11/4 cups water
- ¾ cup tomato paste (6 oz can)
- ¾ teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon Accent
- 1 pound can pork and beans
- 1 can lima beans, drained
- **Biscuits:**
- 11/2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- Milk (enough to make 1/2 cup with egg)
- 1 tablespoon salad oil
- 1/2 cup sliced stuffed olives
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1 cup reserved meat mixture
<|steps|>
**Casserole:** Sauté ground meat, celery, onion, green peppers, and garlic in a large skillet; drain.
Add water, tomato paste, salt, paprika, and Accent; simmer for 5 minutes.
Reserve 1 cup of meat mixture for biscuits.
Add pork and beans and lima beans to the remaining meat mixture, then transfer to an 8 x 13-inch or 2-quart baking dish.
**Biscuits:** Sift flour, baking powder, and salt; cut in shortening.
Combine egg with enough milk to make ½ cup, add to flour mixture, and stir until dough clings together.
Knead dough lightly about 12 times, then roll into a triangle.
Brush with salad oil, combine reserved meat, olives, almonds, and paprika, and spread on dough.
Roll dough as for a jelly roll, slice into 1-inch biscuits, and place on top of casserole.
Dot biscuits with butter and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 425°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FLOUNDER FLORENTINE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg frozen chopped spinach
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 tbsp butter or margarine
- 1 12-oz pkg frozen flounder fillets, thawed
- 0.5 cup undiluted evaporated milk
- 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
- 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 0.5 tsp dry mustard
- Dash nutmeg
- Paprika, optional
- Red pepper, optional
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook spinach as label directs; season with salt, pepper, and butter.
Place spinach in a greased 10x6x2-inch baking dish.
Arrange fillets on spinach.
Mix milk, cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and nutmeg; pour over fillets.
Bake 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Sprinkle with paprika and red pepper if desired, for 3-4 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (300) cans cut asparagus
- 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, diced
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Drain asparagus.
Alternate layers of asparagus, soup, eggs, cheese, and crumbs in a greased casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI BAKE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. pork sausage
- 1/3 cup chopped onion
- 1/3 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. cumin (optional)
- 1 No. 2 1/2 can stewed tomatoes (approx. 3 1/2 cups)
- 2 - 10 oz. pkgs. frozen succotash or 2 - 1 lb. cans
- 1 1/2 cups enriched corn meal (self-rising)
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/2-3/4 cup milk
- 2 Tbsp. sausage drippings
- Green pepper rings
- Pimiento strips
<|steps|>
Brown sausage in a 10-inch skillet, add onion and green pepper, fry until tender.
Drain fat, reserve drippings.
Add salt, chili powder, cumin, tomatoes, and succotash to sausage mixture.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer 30 minutes until succotash is tender.
Mix corn meal with egg, milk, and sausage drippings until moistened.
Spoon onto hot chili mixture, top with green pepper rings and pimiento strips.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 16.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOW-CHOW PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gallons cabbage, chopped
- 1 quart onions, chopped
- 1 cup salt
- 1 gallon vinegar
- 4 lbs brown sugar
- 5 tbsp mustard
- 2 scant tbsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp ground cloves
- 1.5 tbsp turmeric
- 2 tbsp celery seed
- 1.5 cups white mustard seed
<|steps|>
Combine cabbage, onions, and salt; let stand overnight.
Drain in the morning and add vinegar, brown sugar, mustard, black pepper, cloves, turmeric, celery seed, and mustard seed.
Cook for about 2 hours.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 qts. water
- 1 tsp. whole cloves
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1/3 cup. tea or 15 tea bags
- 1 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 3/4 cup. fresh lemon juice
<|steps|>
Add spices to water. Bring water to a full boil.
Remove from heat. Add tea immediately.
Brew 4 minutes. Strain.
Add sugar, stir until dissolved.
Add fruit juices.
To reheat for serving, place over low heat. Do not boil.
Serves 25 to 30.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAR-B-Q-CHICKEN IN THE BAG**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Place in oven bag, pour barbecue sauce over chicken.
Seal bag, make a few slits, bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED HAM FINGER ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Thinly sliced bread
- Softened horseradish butter
- Paper-thin baked ham slices
<|steps|>
Slice bread very thin and spread with softened horseradish butter.
Place a slice of paper-thin baked ham on each bread slice.
Roll up the bread slices.
Toast under a broiler, turning to brown evenly on all sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1 heaping tbsp lard
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
- 2.25 cups flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 6 tbsp melted lard
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients and work in lard.
Add buttermilk to make a soft dough.
Knead well, roll out to 0.5 inch thickness.
Bake in a 450°F oven until golden brown.
**WAFFLES**
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add buttermilk to make a thin batter, then add egg and beat well.
Add melted lard.
Bake in a waffle iron.
Serve with melted butter and sorghum.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BRITTLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 cup. peanuts
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, corn syrup, and water to 275°F, add peanuts and butter.
Cook to 300°F, remove from heat, add baking soda and salt, stir.
Pour onto greased slab, spread thin, break when cool.
**DIVINITY**
Cook sugar, corn syrup, and water to hard ball stage (250°F).
Beat egg whites until stiff, slowly pour in hot syrup, beating constantly.
Add vanilla and nuts, beat until mixture holds shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**PRALINES**
Cook sugar, brown sugar, and milk to soft ball stage (235°F).
Add butter and pecans, cook 2 minutes more.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, beat until thick.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**FUDGE**
Cook sugar, milk, butter, and cocoa to soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla, cool without stirring.
Beat until thick, add nuts if using, pour into greased pan, cut when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can tomato juice
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 1 large piece celery, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- Small piece garlic
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp pickling spice
- 1.5 envelopes gelatine
- Cold water, for soaking
- Chopped olives, optional
- Pecans, optional
- Celery, optional
- Shrimp, optional
<|steps|>
Boil tomato juice, sugar, vinegar, celery, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and pickling spice for 10 minutes.
If too thick, add a little water.
Strain and, while hot, add gelatine soaked in cold water for 5 minutes.
Serve plain after chilling, or add chopped olives, pecans, celery, or shrimp as it begins to congeal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS PEA CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 stick butter
- 1 can asparagus tips
- 2 tbsp. cheese, grated
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. almonds, sliced (optional)
- 2 cup. canned sweet peas, drained
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, sliced
- 1 can mushroom soup, undiluted
- 1/2 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Use part of the butter to grease a casserole dish.
Make layers of peas, asparagus, egg slices, and cheese in the casserole.
Add soup and milk.
Cover with cracker crumbs and almonds.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake 30 minutes at 425 degrees.
Yield: 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Fresh bread slices
- Finely ground cooked chicken
- Minced broiled mushrooms
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Onion, to taste
- Thickened chicken broth
<|steps|>
Trim edges from fresh bread slices.
Mix ground chicken, mushrooms, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and a hint of onion with enough thickened chicken broth to make a spread.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
Roll each slice and secure with a toothpick if needed.
Optionally, store in a home freezer.
Toast in the oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 6 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Gradually add sifted flour and mix well.
Add vanilla.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BOILED COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 tbsp cocoa
- 0.5 stick butter or margarine
- 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
- 2.5 cups one-minute oatmeal
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 0.5 cup milk
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and cocoa, then add milk and butter.
Boil exactly 1 minute.
Add peanut butter, oatmeal, and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper, for about 24 cookies.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 10 large cooked shrimp
- 1/4 cup. mayonnaise
- 3 shakes Tabasco sauce
- 1 tsp. grated onion
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 pint sour cream
<|steps|>
Blend shrimp, mayonnaise, Tabasco, onion, salt, pepper, and sour cream in a blender.
Chill before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. light Karo
- 1/2 cup. dark Karo
- 2 Tbsp. oleo
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 unbaked pie shell
<|steps|>
Beat eggs, add sugar and Karo, and mix well.
Add oleo, salt, pecans, and vanilla; mix until oleo is in small pieces.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 325-350°F for about 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. MOSBY'S EGG PLANT SOUFFLÉ**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 medium eggplant
- 2 teaspoons butter
- 2 teaspoons flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup grated cheese
- Broiled bacon, for garnish
- 3/4 cup soft bread crumbs
- 2 teaspoons grated onion
- 1 teaspoon tomato catsup
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Dash of cayenne
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
Peel eggplant and cook in salted water until tender. Drain and mash thoroughly.
Make a cream sauce with butter, flour, and milk.
When thickened, add mashed eggplant, onion, bread crumbs, catsup, beaten egg yolks, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into a buttered casserole and bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.
Garnish with broiled bacon before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope Knox gelatin
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 large can grated pineapple
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 cup Philadelphia cream cheese (8 oz)
- 0.5 lb Velveeta cheese, cut small
<|steps|>
Heat pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice until sugar melts.
Dissolve gelatin in cold water and add to cooled pineapple mixture.
Stir in Velveeta, cream cheese, and pecans.
Pour into molds and chill until set, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small garlic clove, crushed
- 0.75 cup mayonnaise
- Juice of 1-2 lemons
- 0.25 cup ketchup
- Paprika, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 No. 2 can sauerkraut
- 2 medium apples, sliced, unpeeled
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
<|steps|>
Mix garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, ketchup, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Optionally add blue or Roquefort cheese.
Prepare the day before for best flavor, for 6-8 servings.
**RELISH**
Add apples and brown sugar to sauerkraut.
Simmer until apples disintegrate, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY CHICKEN LAYER**
<|ingredients|>
- **Layer I:**
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 pound can whole cranberry sauce
- 1 (9 oz) can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans or other nuts
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- **Layer II:**
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup chicken stock
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup chicken stock
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 2 tablespoons chopped parsley
- Salad greens, mayonnaise, and pecan halves for garnish
<|steps|>
**Layer I:** Soften 1 envelope gelatin in ¼ cup cold water, dissolve over hot water.
Add cranberry sauce, crushed pineapple, chopped pecans, and lemon juice to gelatin.
Pour into a 10 x 16 x 1½-inch baking dish rubbed with salad oil, chill until set.
**Layer II:** Soften 1 envelope gelatin in ¼ cup chicken stock, dissolve over hot water.
Blend mayonnaise, ½ cup chicken stock, diced celery, and chopped parsley with gelatin.
Pour over the set first layer and chill until firm.
Cut into squares, invert onto salad greens, and top with mayonnaise and a pecan half.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 4 bananas
- 1 pkg. dates
- 1/2 lb. grapes
- 1/4 lb. marshmallows
- 1 cup. pineapple juice
- Juice of 1 orange
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 eggs, well beaten
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, bananas, dates, grapes, and marshmallows.
Make dressing: combine pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, cornstarch, and eggs, cook slowly until thick.
Cool dressing, pour over fruits.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPINACH RING WITH GARNISHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can chopped spinach
- 1 tablespoon butter or bacon drippings
- 1 1/2 eggs
- 2 slices bread, soaked in water
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Parslied potato balls, for garnish
- Buttered carrot spears, for garnish
- Mushroom sauce (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook spinach in butter or bacon drippings until all juice is evaporated.
Add eggs and squeezed-out bread slices to the spinach.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice to taste.
Pour into a buttered ring mold and bake at 250°F for 30 minutes.
Unmold onto a serving dish.
Fill the center with parslied potato balls and arrange buttered carrot spears at the base.
Optionally, serve with mushroom sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE O'BRIEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup diced green pepper
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups uncooked rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 cup chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook green pepper in butter until tender.
Add rice, chicken broth, and salt; heat to boiling and stir once.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 14 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and toss lightly with pimiento.
Serve hot.
Note: Rice keeps well in the refrigerator, reheats easily, and can be frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICEBOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. warm water
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 2 eggs
- 5-6 cup. flour
- 2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix potatoes, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Dissolve yeast in warm water, add to potato mixture with eggs.
Add flour to make soft dough, knead until smooth.
Place in greased bowl, refrigerate, use as needed.
Shape into rolls, let rise, bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
**ROLLS**
Mix dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Add milk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into rolls.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. ground pork
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 cup. catsup
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEXAS CHILI**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. beef, chili plate ground
- 1/2 lb. lean pork, chili plate ground
- 2 cans tomato paste
- 3 Tbsp. chili powder
- 2 Tbsp. ground cumin
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 large pod garlic
- 1 large onion
- 2 cans ranch style beans
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 No. 2 1/2 can tomatoes
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 2 env. spaghetti sauce mix
- 1/3 pkg. lasagna noodles
- 2 (6 oz.) pkg. Mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup. cream style cottage cheese
- 1/2 cup. grated Parmesan cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Minced garlic, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook beef, pork, chopped onion, and garlic in a skillet until medium well done.
Transfer to a pot, add tomato paste, chili powder, cumin, salt, and water to desired consistency.
Simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
Add washed beans and cook for 20 more minutes.
Serve with crackers. Serves 8.
**LASAGNA**
Brown beef slowly, spooning off excess grease.
Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, spaghetti sauce mix, and garlic; simmer covered for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Salt to taste.
Cook and drain noodles according to package directions.
In a greased 11 1/2 x 7 1/2 x 1 1/2 inch baking dish, layer 1/3 meat sauce, 1/2 noodles, 1/2 Mozzarella, and 1/2 cottage cheese; repeat layers, ending with sauce.
Top with Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
Let stand before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI CON CARNE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can kidney beans
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add beans, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sifted corn meal
- 1/4 cup flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- Buttermilk, as needed
- 1 egg (optional)
- 1 tablespoon oil (optional)
- Oil, for pan
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Sift corn meal, flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together.
Add enough buttermilk to form a batter.
Optionally, mix in egg and 1 tablespoon oil.
Heat oil in a baking pan.
Pour batter into the hot pan.
Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.25 cup butter
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 cup milk
- 1.5 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp baking soda
- Pinch of salt
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 cup stewed, chopped prunes
- 1 cup pure maple syrup
- 2 egg whites
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 0.75 cup shortening
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1 package dates
- 0.5 package seedless raisins
- 2 cups pecans
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tbsp boiling water
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and butter, then add eggs one at a time and milk.
Sift flour with baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; stir into mixture.
Add prunes and mix.
Bake in a loaf pan at 350°F for about 40 minutes.
Boil maple syrup until it spins a thread, pour over stiffly beaten egg whites, and beat until thick.
Ice the cake with maple icing.
**ROCKS**
Cream shortening and sugar, then add beaten eggs.
Dredge dates, raisins, and pecans in flour, then add to mixture.
Dissolve baking soda in boiling water and add.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.
Bake in a moderate oven for about 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT PENNIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. carrots, sliced like pennies
- 1 cup. Campbell's tomato soup
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. mustard
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup. oil
- 3/4 cup. vinegar
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 1 small green pepper, sliced in rounds
<|steps|>
Cook carrots until done.
Blend tomato soup, sugar, mustard, salt, pepper, oil, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce.
Layer carrots, onions, and green peppers in a dish.
Pour blended sauce over layers and marinate for 1-2 days.
Heat in oven at 300°F for about 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH FRIED ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 6 medium onions
- 1 cup. flour
- Wesson oil or Snowdrift (for frying)
<|steps|>
Beat egg, add salt and flour, beat until free from lumps.
Slice onions about 1/4 inch thick, separate into rings, dip into batter.
Fry in hot grease a few at a time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 sticks margarine
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 box coconut
- 1/2 pint whipping cream (optional)
- 10 cherries (optional)
<|steps|>
Melt margarine in the bottom of a 9 x 12-inch pan or casserole dish.
Sprinkle dry yellow cake mix evenly over the margarine.
Spread crushed pineapple evenly over the cake mix.
Sprinkle coconut evenly on top.
Bake at 325°F for about 35 minutes until the coconut is lightly browned.
Top with whipped cream and cherries, if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ROLLED GRAPE LEAVES**
<|ingredients|>
- Prepared grape leaves (from import store)
- 1 lb. coarse ground sirloin steak
- 1 cup. raw rice
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. crushed mint leaves
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- Juice of 2-3 lemons
- 1 cup. water
- 1 1/2 lb. lean beef, thinly sliced
- 2 bunches scallions, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 large can mushroom pieces
- 3 medium onions, sliced
- 1 head Chinese cabbage, shredded
- 1 can chicken broth
- 1/2 cup. soy sauce
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. accent
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 can bean sprouts
- 1 can sukiyaki (no tomo) or 1 can bamboo shoots and 1 additional can mushroom pieces
- Cooked rice
- Cooking oil
<|steps|>
Unroll and rinse grape leaves one section at a time.
Combine meat, rice, salt, mint, and pepper; work together with fingers.
Place meat mixture on a leaf, fold ends or sides in, and roll firmly.
Pack rolls in a heavy saucepan or Dutch oven, pour lemon juice and water over 40-50 rolls, and sprinkle with salt.
Anchor with a bowl on top, cover, and cook over low heat for 40-50 minutes, ensuring 1/2 c. water remains.
Serve to be eaten with fingers or as part of a meal.
**SUKIYAKI**
Slice beef thinly across the grain (easier if partially frozen).
Heat a small amount of oil in a large skillet, sauté beef quickly until browned.
Add scallions, mushrooms, onions, cabbage, bean sprouts, and sukiyaki or substitutes.
Add 1 c. chicken broth, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and accent.
Cook covered for 5 minutes over medium heat, then uncovered for 5 more minutes, tossing lightly until vegetables are crisp.
Add more broth if needed.
Serve with rice, a green salad, garlic butter French bread, and iced tea.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN LIVERS ON TOAST POINTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds chicken livers
- 1¾ cups flour
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 8 slices salt pork or country bacon
- 2 medium onions, finely chopped
- 1/2 pound thin-sliced mushrooms
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 5 cups chicken broth
- 2 or 3 drops Kitchen Bouquet (optional)
- Pinch of nutmeg
- 11/2 cups sherry
- 1 cup sour cream
- Toast points
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
Cut chicken livers in half and toss in 1 cup flour mixed with 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Sauté salt pork or bacon until very crisp, remove, drain on paper towels, and keep warm.
Sauté livers in the drippings until cooked, then remove and drain on paper towels.
Sauté onions in the same pan until almost tender, add mushrooms, and cook until tender; remove and add to livers.
Add 2 tablespoons butter to the drippings, stir in ¾ cup flour, and cook, stirring constantly, until flour begins to brown (avoid burning).
Add chicken broth and stir until smooth and thickened.
If the sauce looks pale, add Kitchen Bouquet for color.
Season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper to taste.
Return livers, onions, and mushrooms to the sauce and heat through.
Stir in sour cream and sherry.
Serve on toast points, sprinkle with crumbled pork or bacon, and dust with paprika.
Note: Can be prepared ahead, reheated at serving time (add cream and sherry then), or frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 1/4 cup. warm water
- 1 cup. milk, scalded
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. pecans
<|steps|>
Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Mix milk, sugar, shortening, and salt, cool, add yeast, egg, and flour, knead until smooth.
Let rise until doubled, punch down, roll out.
Spread with butter, brown sugar, and pecans, roll up, cut into slices.
Place in greased pan, let rise, bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE CREAM PUNCH FOR 50**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 gal. sherbet
- 6 bottles ginger ale
- 4 cup. pineapple juice
- 1 gal. vanilla ice cream
- 2 small cans orange juice
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl.
Stir gently to mix and serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACKBERRY ACID**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 lbs blackberries
- 2 quarts boiling water
- 5 oz tartaric acid
- White sugar, 1 lb per pint of juice
<|steps|>
Add boiling water to blackberries and let stand for 48 hours.
Drip juice without squeezing.
Add tartaric acid to juice.
Measure juice and add 1 lb sugar per pint.
Let stand until sugar dissolves, then bottle.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (3-pound) fryer or hen
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil or oleo
- ¾ cup celery, chopped
- 1 cup bell pepper, chopped
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 can chicken broth
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Spaghetti (quantity not specified, cook as needed)
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, cook in a small amount of water until tender, then cool and bone, cutting into small pieces.
Sauté celery, onions, and bell pepper in cooking oil or oleo.
Add cream of chicken soup and chicken broth, then let simmer.
Add boned chicken to the mixture.
Cook spaghetti as usual and drain.
In a greased 2-quart casserole, layer spaghetti and chicken mixture.
Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE YAMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. raw sweet potatoes
- 1 gal. water
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. white corn syrup
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 cup. crushed pineapple
- 4 Tbsp. butter
<|steps|>
Add salt to 1 gal. water and shred yams directly into it.
Combine sugar, syrup, and 1/2 c. water in a saucepan; cook until it forms a light syrup.
Drain potatoes, rinse, and pat dry.
Place in a baking dish, pour pineapple over potatoes, then add cooked syrup.
Dot with butter.
Bake uncovered at 350°F for about 35 minutes or until potatoes are translucent.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MY FAVORITE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 cup. cooked green beans
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion in skillet.
Add soup and green beans, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with mashed potatoes and cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>
